titleInfo.title: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H. CON. RES. 71, CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018

name.namePart: Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

extension.searchTitle: PROVIDING FOR CONSIDERATION OF H. CON. RES. 71, CONCURRENT RESOLUTION ON THE BUDGET FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 159

congVote.result: So the previous question was ordered.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2018 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2019 through 2027
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House considered H. Con. Res. 71, establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2018 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2019 through 2027. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, October 5th.<P/>Grijalva amendment in the nature of a substitute (No. 1 printed in H. Rept. 115-339) that sought to invest $2 trillion in 21st century infrastructure and jobs; including comprehensive immigration reform, which protects DACA, and provide $200 billion for immediate hurricane disaster recovery efforts and climate change research (by a recorded vote of 108 ayes to 314 noes, Roll No. 553); and<P/>Scott (VA) amendment in the nature of a substitute (No. 2 printed in H. Rept. 115-339) that sought to make investments in education, job training, transportation and infrastructure, and advanced D1053research and development programs that accelerate economic recovery; protect the social safety net without cutting Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid, or SNAP; and reduce annual budget deficit to 2.7% of GDP by FY 2027 (by a recorded vote of 130 ayes to 292 noes, Roll No. 554).<P/>H. Res. 553, the rule providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 71) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 232 ayes to 188 noes, Roll No. 552, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 189 nays, Roll No. 551.

congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2018 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2019 through 2027
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House considered H. Con. Res. 71, establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2018 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2019 through 2027. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, October 5th.<P/>Grijalva amendment in the nature of a substitute (No. 1 printed in H. Rept. 115-339) that sought to invest $2 trillion in 21st century infrastructure and jobs; including comprehensive immigration reform, which protects DACA, and provide $200 billion for immediate hurricane disaster recovery efforts and climate change research (by a recorded vote of 108 ayes to 314 noes, Roll No. 553); and<P/>Scott (VA) amendment in the nature of a substitute (No. 2 printed in H. Rept. 115-339) that sought to make investments in education, job training, transportation and infrastructure, and advanced D1053research and development programs that accelerate economic recovery; protect the social safety net without cutting Social Security, Medicare, Medicaid, or SNAP; and reduce annual budget deficit to 2.7% of GDP by FY 2027 (by a recorded vote of 130 ayes to 292 noes, Roll No. 554).<P/>H. Res. 553, the rule providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 71) was agreed to by a recorded vote of 232 ayes to 188 noes, Roll No. 552, after the previous question was ordered by a yea-and-nay vote of 231 yeas to 189 nays, Roll No. 551.

congVote.result: So the amendment in the nature of a substitute was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2018 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2019 through 2027
Establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2018 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2019 through 2027

Res. 71, establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2018 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2019 through 2027. Res. 71, establishing the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2018 and setting forth the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2019 through 2027. Consideration is expected to resume tomorrow, October 5th.<P/>Grijalva amendment in the nature of a substitute (No. 1 printed in H. congVote.result: The PRESIDING OFFICER. Under the previous order, the motion to reconsider is considered made and laid upon the table and the President will be immediately notified of the Senate's action.

congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate resumed consideration of the nomination of Randal Quarles, of Colorado, to be a Member of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System.<P/>During consideration of this nomination today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By 62 yeas to 33 nays (Vote No. 212), Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the nomination.
